title: Is your firm one of the best places to work in accounting?

questions.question: Does your firm allow paid time off for community service activities or volunteer work?
questions.takeaway: Younger staff in particular are likely to expect their employer to support charitable activities.

questions.question: Does your firm offer telecommuting options to staff?
questions.takeaway: It's important that telecommuting options be regularly available – not just for special occasions or only some individuals.

questions.question: Does your firm provide any fitness or wellness programs?
questions.takeaway: Helping staff stay fit and healthy isn't just good for them – it can reduce sick days, and may even lead to lower insurance costs.

questions.question: Are staff members' immediate families invited to firm events?
questions.takeaway: More and more firms are reaching out to include employees' families.

questions.question: Does your firm offer tuition reimbursement or assistance for additional degrees or credentials?
questions.takeaway: Support for advanced degrees like MBAs or LLMs, and for specialty credentials are a much-appreciated part of staff development.

questions.question: Does your firm have any formalized succession planning programs or practices?
questions.takeaway: Uncertainty surrounding the future leadership of the firm – or even a department – can drive staff away.

questions.question: Does your firm offer flexible hours or compressed work weeks as an option?
questions.takeaway: Flexible hours are a cornerstone of work-life balance that no firm can afford to ignore.

questions.question: Does your firm offer personal development or stress management workshops, seminars or classes?
questions.takeaway: Staff expect employers to help them grow, and to manage the stress of their jobs.

questions.question: Does your firm match employee contributions to a retirement savings plans account?
questions.takeaway: It's not enough to just have a retirement savings plan – staff expect their employers to help with contributions.

questions.question: Does your firm share information on how it is doing financially with staff?
questions.takeaway: Younger generations of employees don't want to be kept in the dark about how their firm is performing.
